intro: Hypochaeris spinneri, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Hypochaeris spinneri is often found in regions with temperate climates and is known for its ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
